com.optimizely.ab

Class Optimizely

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.optimizely.ab.Optimizely

  • @ThreadSafe
public class Optimizely
extends java.lang.Object
    Top-level container class for Optimizely functionality. Thread-safe, so can be created as a singleton and safely passed around. Example instantiation: 
         Optimizely optimizely = Optimizely.builder(projectWatcher, eventHandler).build();
    To activate an experiment and perform variation specific processing: 
         Variation variation = optimizely.activate(experimentKey, userId, attributes);
     if (variation.is("ALGORITHM_A")) {
         // execute code for algorithm A
     } else if (variation.is("ALGORITHM_B")) {
         // execute code for algorithm B
     } else {
         // execute code for default algorithm
     }
    NOTE: by default, all exceptions originating from Optimizely calls are suppressed. For example, attempting to activate an experiment that does not exist in the project config will cause an error to be logged, and for the "control" variation to be returned.

      • isFeatureEnabled

        @Nonnull
public java.lang.Boolean isFeatureEnabled(@Nonnull
                                                    java.lang.String featureKey,
                                                    @Nonnull
                                                    java.lang.String userId)
        Determine whether a boolean feature is enabled. Send an impression event if the user is bucketed into an experiment using the feature.
        Parameters:
        featureKey - The unique key of the feature.
        userId - The ID of the user.
        Returns:
        True if the feature is enabled. False if the feature is disabled. False if the feature is not found.

      • isFeatureEnabled

        @Nonnull
public java.lang.Boolean isFeatureEnabled(@Nonnull

                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes)
        Determine whether a boolean feature is enabled. Send an impression event if the user is bucketed into an experiment using the feature.
        Parameters:
        featureKey - The unique key of the feature.
        userId - The ID of the user.
        attributes - The user's attributes.
        Returns:
        True if the feature is enabled. False if the feature is disabled. False if the feature is not found.

      • setForcedVariation

        public boolean setForcedVariation(@Nonnull
                                  java.lang.String experimentKey,
                                  @Nonnull
                                  java.lang.String userId,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String variationKey)
        Force a user into a variation for a given experiment. The forced variation value does not persist across application launches. If the experiment key is not in the project file, this call fails and returns false. If the variationKey is not in the experiment, this call fails.
        Parameters:
        experimentKey - The key for the experiment.
        userId - The user ID to be used for bucketing.
        variationKey - The variation key to force the user into. If the variation key is null then the forcedVariation for that experiment is removed.
        Returns:
        boolean A boolean value that indicates if the set completed successfully.

      • getForcedVariation

        @Nullable
public Variation getForcedVariation(@Nonnull
                                               java.lang.String experimentKey,
                                               @Nonnull
                                               java.lang.String userId)
        Gets the forced variation for a given user and experiment. This method just calls into the ProjectConfig.getForcedVariation(String, String) method of the same signature.
        Parameters:
        experimentKey - The key for the experiment.
        userId - The user ID to be used for bucketing.
        Returns:
        The variation the user was bucketed into. This value can be null if the forced variation fails.

      • getProjectConfig

        @Nonnull
public ProjectConfig getProjectConfig()
        Returns:
